meta.content: At Bruneau-Grand View Joint School District, we want to see “Every Child Learning.” Located in the southwestern corner of Idaho, our small, tight-knit community is dedicated to the success of every child. Involved parents, caring citizens, and high-achieving students are just a few of the ingredients in our recipe to success.

article.p: In a small community like ours, area schools are often the center of the neighborhood. It’s where children and families alike gather for the betterment of the community. To that end, we have many family-friendly events and programs planned throughout the year. We also like to publicize the accomplishments of our students and staff. Stop by often to find out all the latest!

div.p: Bruneau Grand View School District will be serving free breakfasts and lunches for all children 18 years and younger (regardless of whether or not they are BGV students.) Meals will be available Monday through Thursday and can be picked up at one of the bus drop sites (times and locations listed below) or at curb-side pick-up at Grand View Elementary and Bruneau Elementary from 11:30 a.m. until 12:30 p.m. Children must be physically present to pick up meals.
Homework for the week will also be available for pick-up at these locations on Mondays, and assignments can be dropped of daily to be delivered back to teachers.

div.p: Welcome back! As we return from spring break, we are embarking on a new journey of utilizing a virtual classroom environment for our students. Rimrock teachers have created a newsletter that includes important information, including contact information, accessing Google Classroom, office hours, and attendance. For your ease, we have put all the Rimrock parent/student newsletters in one convenient place. Please visit our Rimrock Junior/Senior High page often to keep up with the latest news.

Our buses will run Monday, delivering homework to those who want/need it. It'll be the same assignments your students have on Google Classroom - but it'll be a paper/pencil version. If you would like a printed copy of the assignment(s) for your student(s), please indicate this to your child's teacher ASAP so we can get copies ready for Monday morning's route.

We will deliver homework (only) each Monday (for the week) to students, and we will pick-up assignments daily and deliver them back to teachers. Ms. Paulina Bravo and Mrs. Karlee Aquiso will be riding the yellow buses to assist drivers with homework and food distribution.
Please read the entire BGV update: bus drop sites smore newsletter.
On March 23, the ISBE met in a special session and determined the following:

ol.li: Idaho schools will be closed through (at least) April 20. This action was taken to slow the spread of COVID-19 through Idaho. This closure may be extended past April 20 - this determination will be made by the ISBE board as the date approaches.
The SAT will be excused this spring. Idaho HS students will not be required to take it.
The ISAT is excused - students in Idaho will not be required to take it.
Schools may be reimbursed for using school buses to deliver school lunches and homework/assignments to students at designated drop spots.

div.p: For more information, please visit our COVID-19 and ISBE update.

In a special board meeting on March 17, trustees listened to parent, student, and staff concerns related to the COVID-19 outbreak in the U.S. As a result of these concerns, and to help slow the spread of COVID-19 in Idaho, BGV will close its three schools to students starting March 19. For more information, please read our update and plan on COVID-19.

Though Idaho has its first confirmed case of COVID-19 in the area (Ada County), little has changed for BGV for the time being. We're seeing a variety of responses in an effort to slow or eliminate the spread of COVID-19 to new communities. Please take a moment to read our coronavirus update.

As the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) continues to spread through the United States, we are seeing a variety of responses in an effort to slow or eliminate the spread of COVID-19 to new communities. In an effort to help slow/eliminate the spread of COVID-19 into our school communities, Bruneau-Grand View Joint School District is emphasizing actions such as staying home when sick (both staff and students), appropriately covering coughs and sneezes, cleaning frequently touched surfaces (using disinfectant wipes and bacteria/virus-killing agents, and washing hands often.

Please know that we continue to follow guidelines to keep our students and staff safe during this time. We continue to follow the recommendations and guidelines of Central District Health (CDH) as we learn more about the coronavirus.
Please take a moment to read Superintendent Ryan Cantrell's complete letter regarding COVID-19.

Parents, on March 18, your student brought home a school device (iPad or Chromebook), charger, and headphones. We are providing these devices in case our schools remain closed for an extended period of time. We invite you to read through our letter to parents regarding the home-use of these devices.

Superintendent Cantrell sent a survey to BGV parents asking their opinion regarding school closures related to illness in BGV schools. He then shared this information with BGV Trustees in February's board meeting. We invite you to read through the details regarding this topic in this recent letter to parents.
